spell.name: Acid Rain
entries: Until the spell ends, acid rain falls in a 40-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is lightly obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

Chemical pools accumulate on the ground in the area, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls {@condition prone} in the pools, taking an additional {@damage 3d6} acid damage.

components.m: a pinch of sulfur and ground coal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the acid damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.
